definitions.definition: a measure, quantity, or frequency, typically one measured against some other quantity or measure.
examples: the crime rate rose by 26 percent

definitions.definition: the speed with which something moves, happens, or changes.
a fixed price paid or charged for something, especially goods or services.
the amount of a charge or payment expressed as a percentage of some other amount, or as a basis of calculation.
examples: you'll find our current interest rate very competitive

definitions.definition: (in the UK) a tax on land and buildings paid to the local authority by a business, and formerly also by occupants of private property.
assign a standard or value to (something) according to a particular scale.
examples: they were asked to rate their ability at different driving maneuvers

definitions.definition: assign a standard, optimal, or limiting rating to (a piece of equipment).
examples: its fuel economy is rated at 25 miles a gallon in the city

definitions.definition: assess the value of (a property) for the purpose of levying a local tax.
consider to be of a certain quality, standard, or rank.
examples: he rates the company's stock a “buy.”
synonyms: count as "the scheme was rated effective"

definitions.definition: be regarded in a specified way.
examples: Jeff still rates as one of the nicest people I have ever met
the ambassador rated a bulletproof car and a police escort
synonyms: be deserving of "he rated only a brief mention"

examples: he rated the young man soundly for his want of respect

definitions.definition: soak (flax or hemp) in water to soften it and separate the fibers.
